title: First-of-its-kind Covid study yields valuable new insight on how we get infected
description: It takes just a tiny virus-laden droplet -- about the width of a human blood cell -- to infect someone with Covid-19.

title: Ikea will pay you to get its old furniture back
description: Can't stand that old bookcase and dining table with the mismatched chairs you once thought looked so cool? If you bought them at Ikea, the retailer will pay you to get them back.

title: Scientists make history by sequencing complete human genome for first time
description: In 2003, the Human Genome Project made history when it sequenced 92% of the human genome. But for nearly two decades since, scientists have struggled to decipher the remaining 8%. Now, a team of nearly 100 scientists from the Telomere-to-Telomere (T2T) Consortium has unveiled the complete human genome -- the first time it's been sequenced in its entirety, the researchers say.

title: They fell in love on a Greyhound Bus 35 years ago. They've been together ever since
description: When Tiffany Woods met Bridgette, she was at a crossroads.

title: Razzies rescind Bruce Willis award after family reveals actor has aphasia
description: The Razzies, a tongue-in-cheek award show that hands out honors to the worst cinema of the year, has rescinded its prize for Bruce Willis after the actor's family revealed he is struggling with aphasia, a medical condition that affects his cognitive abilities.

title: Marjorie Taylor Greene's intolerant attack on Pete Buttigieg sparks outrage
description: Georgia Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene called out Secretary of Transportation Pete Buttigieg on oil drilling... and somehow ended up warning him to "stay out of our girls' bathrooms." In today's episode of The Point, CNN's Chris Cillizza breaks down her comment.

title: 'The last straw': Former oligarch on renouncing Russian citizenship
description: CNN's Hadas Gold speaks to Leonid Nevzlin, a former oligarch who moved to Israel nearly 20 years ago, on his decision to publicly renounce his Russian citizenship.

title: Chernobyl: Russian forces have left, Ukraine says
description: Russian forces have withdrawn from Chernobyl, the site of the world's worst nuclear disaster, the state enterprise overseeing Ukraine's nuclear power plants said on Thursday.

title: Why Brittney Griner's plight deserves our undivided attention
description: A version of this story appeared in CNN's Race Deconstructed newsletter. To get it in your inbox every week, sign up for free here.

title: Russia says its military is regrouping. Here's what could happen next
description: Russia's military says it has moved on to a new phase of its so-called "special military operation" in Ukraine, claiming that it is shifting its focus to the Donbas region in Ukraine's east.

title: Russia doubles down on threat to cut off gas to West if countries don't pay in rubles
description: Russia has doubled down on its threat to cut off natural gas supplies to Western countries that refuse to pay in rubles, raising new concerns about an energy supply crunch and rationing in Europe.

title: Who should be getting a 2nd coronavirus booster shot? Our medical expert explains
description: On Tuesday, the US Food and Drug Administration expanded its authorization of the Pfizer/BioNTech and Moderna Covid-19 vaccines. Now, adults ages 50 and older are able to get a second booster if at least four months have passed since their first one.

title: Georgia says 'unacceptable' for breakaway region to vote on joining Russia
description: Georgia said on Thursday that plans by the Russian-backed breakaway region of South Ossetia to hold a referendum on joining Russia were unacceptable, while the Kremlin stressed no action had been taken to make that happen.

title: Former Disney CEO on opposing 'Don't Say Gay' bill: 'It's about right and wrong'
description: Former Disney CEO Bob Iger is breaking from his successor on Florida's recently passed "Don't Say Gay" law.

title: Lewis Hamilton opens up on struggling 'mentally and emotionally for a long time'
description: Formula One driver Lewis Hamilton said he has "struggled mentally and emotionally for a long time" in a candid social media post on Thursday.

title: Here's exactly why Joe Biden's poll numbers aren't getting better
description: Usually when the United States is involved in an international crisis, the president of the United States experiences a bit of a poll bump -- a rally 'round the flag effect that politically benefits the commander-in-chief.

title: Blue Origin successfully completes fourth space tourism mission
description: Jeff Bezos' Blue Origin just launched its fourth successful space tourism mission, putting yet another feather in the cap of the company that hopes to make these supersonic joyrides a mainstay of pop culture.

title: Bruce Willis's daughter Scout grateful for outpouring of support
description: Bruce Willis and his family shared some personal news this week and his daughter Scout felt the supportive response.

title: China's economy hit by double whammy in March
description: Activity in Chinese manufacturing and services simultaneously contracted in March for the first time since the height of the country's Covid-19 outbreak in 2020, adding to the urgency for more policy intervention to stabilize the economy.

title: Machine Gun Kelly recalls being with Taylor Hawkins days before he died
description: Machine Gun Kelly has shared his experience hanging out with Taylor Hawkins days before the Foo Fighters drummer tragically passed.

title: This may be Trump's most twisted appeal to Putin yet
description: Donald Trump is doing it again -- putting his personal goals and burning zeal for revenge above the national interest -- as he once more appeals for Russian President Vladimir Putin's political help in the midst of the brutality in Ukraine.

title: X gender marker option on passport applications to be available in April, Blinken says
description: US citizens will have the option to select "X" when identifying their gender on US passport applications starting in April and on other documents, Secretary of State Antony Blinken said Thursday.

title: Germans 'will be poorer' because of the war in Ukraine
description: Germany "will be poorer" because of Russia's assault on Ukraine, the government's economy minister has warned, as soaring energy prices fuel record inflation and threaten to tip Europe's biggest economy into a recession.

title: Meet the Korean American who's shaking up entertainment
description: As Covid cases decline and the world reopens, Michelle Zauner is having a moment.

title: Putin's plan to prop up the ruble is working. For now
description: The barrage of sanctions imposed by the West following Russia's invasion of Ukraine decimated the ruble. But one month after the tanks rolled, the currency has made a full recovery and is now trading at levels seen prior to the war. How is that possible?

title: Ambassador Cindy McCain visits food distribution center at the Polish border
description: Cindy McCain, the widow of Sen. John McCain, visits a food distribution center on the Polish border to see what aid is getting to Ukrainian refugees.

title: Will Smith's slap in the name of love is dangerous, experts say
description: "Love will make you do crazy things." That's what actor Will Smith said during his Oscars acceptance speech at Sunday's Academy Awards ceremony.

title: Formula One adds Las Vegas to race calendar from 2023
description: Formula One is heading back to Sin City.

title: Concern grows that North Korea is preparing for first underground nuclear test in years
Former Russian television host explains surprising Putin poll
description: Stanislav Kucher, a long-time former Russian TV host, explains the mindset of the Russian people after an independent pollster finds Russian President Vladimir Putin's approval rating to be over 80 percent.

title: World Cup 2022 draw: Everything you need to know
description: The draw for an unprecedented FIFA World Cup takes place Friday as teams discover their fates for the first winter edition of football's flagship event, in Qatar this December.

title: Why Russia's elite are the key to Putin's downfall
description: President Joe Biden's apparently unplanned remarks suggesting that Russian President Vladimir Putin should not be in power complicate the pursuit of a goal that US and allied leaders likely favor, but which had been better left unspoken.

title: Tiger Woods' return to golf at Masters would be 'phenomenal,' says Rory McIlroy
description: A return to golf for Tiger Woods at the Masters next week would be "phenomenal," says Rory McIlroy.

title: The traveler who's been globetrotting for nearly 10 years
description: He set off on a round-the-world trip in December 2012 and, nearly a decade later, traveler Tom Grond is still globetrotting.

title: 'It's a lie': Ukrainian soldier says he doesn't see decrease in Russian forces in Chernihiv
description: CNN's Zain Asher speaks with Dmytro, a former IT leader who is now defending his city of Chernihiv, Ukraine, against the Russian armed forces.

title: China's tech layoffs could become a self-inflicted headache for Xi
description: China's huge tech sector may be staring at its worst jobs crisis ever.

title: Record crowd watches Barcelona thrash Real Madrid in Women's Champions League
description: History was made on Wednesday as 91,553 fans packed into Camp Nou -- the largest football stadium in Europe -- to watch the second leg of the UEFA Women's Champions League quarterfinal between Barcelona and Real Madrid.

title: 'Frozen zoos' are preserving the world's rarest animals
description: When Kurt Benirschke started collecting skin samples from rare and endangered animals in 1972, he didn't have a firm plan on what to do with them. As a researcher at the University of California San Diego, he believed that one day the tools would be developed to use them to save those animals. A few years later, he moved his collection to San Diego Zoo, and called it the Frozen Zoo.

title: Russian Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov visits China and India under shadow of Ukraine war
description: Russian Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov is meeting his counterparts in China and India this week -- two countries under pressure to condemn Russia's actions in Ukraine as the death toll from the unprovoked conflict rises.

title: The devastating reality for LGBTQ+ people in Hungary
description: This Sunday will be a defining moment in modern Hungarian history -- a day I'm looking to with a mixed sense of hope and worry.

title: Australian TV host set to stand trial in China for allegedly supplying state secrets overseas
description: An Australian TV host is due to face trial in China Thursday for allegedly sharing state secrets in an opaque case that analysts worry may be politically motivated.

title: Paul Herman, actor known for 'The Sopranos' and 'Goodfellas,' has died
description: Paul Herman, an actor known for his roles in "The Sopranos," "Goodfellas" and "The Irishman," has died, according to his manager.

title: Grammy-winning singer Lizzo is launching a shapewear line called Yitty
description: The form-fitting bodysuits and undergarments that make up shapewear have become a lucrative business, with Spanx valued at $1.2 billion and Kim Kardashian's Skims brand propelling her to billionaire status. Now, singer and rapper Lizzo will enter the market next month with Yitty, her new venture offering bras, leggings, shorts and more.
